Subset a studies object

Source: R/generics.R
subset-studies.Rd

You can subset studies by identifier or by position using the `[` operator.

Usage

# S4 method for class 'studies,missing,missing,missing'
x[i, j, ..., drop = FALSE]

# S4 method for class 'studies,numeric,missing,missing'
x[i, j, ..., drop = FALSE]

# S4 method for class 'studies,character,missing,missing'
x[i, j, ..., drop = FALSE]

Arguments

x

A studies object.

i

Position of the identifier or the name of the identifier itself.

j

Not used.

...

Additional arguments not used here.

drop

Not used.

Value

A studies object.

Examples

# Subset a studies object by identifier
studies_ex01['GCST001585']
#> An object of class "studies"
#> Slot "studies":
#> # A tibble: 1 × 13
#>   study_id reported_trait initial_sample_size replication_sample_s…¹ gxe   gxg
